title: Fixed-Income Investment
description: An investment, like a bond, that produces a steady stream of income in the form of interest payments. The borrower, or issuer, can be a governmentâ€”municipal, state or federal; a corporation; or a bank or savings and loan association. Risk factors that may affect the amount you earn on a fixed-income investment include interest rate changes, inflation, and the credit of the issuer. Bonds are the most common types of fixed-income investments, but there are others, such as preferred securities and bank loans.
